title: disappeared tags
content: Hello, I don't know where the mistake is, but it has already happened to me twice that I put "tags" on my emails throughout the year and it just deleted them. After turning it on, I no longer had those "tags" for emails. I put tags for orders with a large number so that I can sort them right away, and when I delete them, it's a lot of work to sort those orders. Can you tell me where the error is?
creator: michal.fujak

title: thunderbird android storage location
content:
my internal storage (64GB) is almost full I would like to use my internal sd-card storage (256GB) as storage location for my email profile folder.

Is it possible ?

creator: regdmslink

title: Profile folder does not exist
content: Hello, When I want to backup my profile, i get an error because the profile folder does not exist. In fact, there is no Thunderbird folder in c:\Users\danie\AppData\Roaming. I found this folder and all my data inside the folder C:\Users\danie\AppData\Local\Packages\MozillaThunderbird.MZLA_h5892qc0xkpca\LocalCache\Roaming\. My Thunderbird is running fine, except that I cannot backup my profile (as it does not exist). The folder when my profile is located currently seems to be a cache folder and I scare that it disappears when the cache will be cleared out. Please help me.
creator: daniel.ouin

title: non riesco ad utilizzare FileLink provider for WebDAV

title: Sent messages
content: Hi. I have Thunderbird installed on my Galaxy S25 phone and Galaxy Tab S8 tablet. If I send an email from either of those 2 devices 2 copies of the same message appear in the 'Sent Items' folder. Two messages also appear in the 'Sent Items' folder of Outlook on my PC. If I send a message from Outlook on my PC only 1 message appears (as it should do). Is there something that can be done to correct this so that the message only appears once? Kind regards, Paul Goddard
creator: pgpaulgoddard

title: Trashcan
content: In Mozilla Thunderbird. My emails that are moved to trash are deleted after a few hours even if I have set it to "Do not delete" a thousand times. Goes on for years - Mozilla updates normally. Tried to create a subfolder under trash, same result. I can never regret a trashed mail the next day. Any Idea... Kind regards Claes mail@clabbe.nu
creator: storolle
